Replies.Reply: Leo Marks    The screen remains dark for a moment.
Blots out what is happening to her.
Those with girls on the front covers - and no front covers on the girls.
What do you do with all your money?
Raise your head, please - and look at the sea.
I just wanted that puzzled look.
I may show you - one day.
You needn't be shy... of me...
Lorraine - let my camera tell you.
I'd like to offer you a drink.
Will you... would you... like to come in?
There's milk... if you'd like some?
I was born in this house Oh?
It's his house - and I'll never sell it... but I can't afford the upkeep, so I let rooms.
... if I charge too much, tell me and I'll tell the agents.
Most of the time, I work in a film studio.
I hope to be a film director...
I have some spare time jobs... as well.
Will you... would you... like to see them now?
Don't know what to show you?
This is the first... twenty-first birthday present... I'll ever have given.
the child's eyes. He moves restlessly.
No, Helen.  Over Helen's shoulder WE SEE something drop onto the child's bed... something which stays quite still for a moment, then starts crawling towards the counterpane. It is a small lizard.
I am saying... goodbye... my mother...
He married her... six weeks after...
The morning that he left for his honeymoon.
He wanted a record of a growing child... complete in every detail - if such a thing were possible - and he tried to make it possible by training a camera on me... at all times...
I never knew... the whole of my childhood... one moment's privacy...
He was interested ... in the reactions of the nervous system...
Especially fear in children - and how they react to it.
I think he learned a lot... from me... I'd wake up... screaming...
I don't know... if he did... but if he did... he'll have learned something of value...
He was famous! Professor A. N. Lewis... three clinics.
They helped make me... what I am.
Not if you do as I tell you.
You haven't... said anything... to anyone?
Not just for you... Viv... I have an agent too - and I want to show him what I can do... I want to direct...
I want... to photograph... the impossible...
Something... that has never been photographed before.
I want... to photograph a murder...
That is something... he never photographed...
I wouldn't care... if I had my picture.
I know. They're branched off this stage - I'm using their juice.
... but they won't interrupt us while we're filming... I've put the red light on.
The difference is... a perfect film...
You stand to lose... a job as an extra... I stand to lose... nothing.
It's time to find out, Viv...

You belong there...  He stares ahead of him, his mind far, far away... then bends and looks into the finder.  There is a single harsh chord of music - and the screen goes dark. It remains dark for a moment.
Through the film, we can see only her eyes - large and wistful.
... and the great ones... feel alone... all the time...
Be patient, Viv... it's going to be worth it.
Ever stood... behind one?  He glances at a nearby dial - only a few feet away from the one which is flickering.
Go and stand on that cross, will you?
Imagine someone... coming towards you... who's going to kill you - regardless of consequences...
Yes - but he knows it... and you don't... and just to kill you...
Stay there, Viv... you're... just right.
Suppose this... were one of his weapons...
Would you... please... wait in there?... Developing.
It isn't much... I don't know anything about... presents for twenty-one... but I saw it this morning... so... please.
I like the design... More milk?
But that's wonderful... what's it about?
Whatever made you... think of that?
There are some things... which I photograph... for nothing.
Helen... if you knew what it meant... for something to happen to me... that I don't have to make happen... it's like... you've given me a twenty-first birthday...
Helen ... I don't know much about...
I'll try to be - I'll try my hardest to be.
Yes, I've a few quite interesting shots of them - it's a chance I never expected!
It will complete a documentary I'm making.
I'd rather not tell you till it's finished. And it soon will be ...
Oh they will - they look very efficient.
I'm afraid they will! But by then...
I'm sure of that - but I'd like to photograph them while they're questioning me.
I don't suppose they'll let me.
Yes, do you think they'll notice?
I've brought the camera in case you want to take the film away.
Called out good night - don't know if she heard?
Took sqme shots, sir - for a film I'm making.
All over the place, sir... it's a documentary.
How do you do... Mrs. Stephens...
... didn't want to be late for Helen.
CLOSE SHOT of Helen kissing her mother and whispering into her ear.
I'm not going to need it tonight!
Can't describe it! Could only photograph it -
There's a small place round the corner... It's awfully good on Christmas Day.
Yes... there aren't too many open then.
Are you ready to talk about your book?
When your book's published - will you go on working in a library?
What made you think of this story?
I'd like to think... I was responsible... in some way...
There isn't a single face that doesn't look like a child's - not a single one - if you catch it at the right moment.
It would be a challenge!... Unlike anything I've photographed!
Everything. But nothing I'd want children to see.
But this would belong to them - and they'd know if it wasn't right... Oh, Helen... I would like to find those faces for you...
You made a promise to your mother -
That's what I was going to say...
Well... I've a little work to do...
I was never allowed a key..., can't get used to them.
I've no one to talk to... in the rooms I live over...
It's a changing bag... we put films in it - so that the light won't spoil them...
It's no good - I was afraid it wouldn't be.
An opportunity... now I must find another.
Please let me finish! It's for Helen!
She wants to see something I've photographed!
I'll never photograph her... I promise you that.
You'll never have to move... because of me... I promise you.
It's been a long time... since anyone did...
I was wondering if you knew my father - Professor Lewis...
You know what he was interested in before he died?
I don't remember what he called it... It was something to do with what causes people to be... peeping Toms...
He thought... it could be cured...
Phone - may be my last chance - and... thanks.
Can't manage Saturday, sir, but they're letting us off early today! This afternoon - after work - may be my last chance!
Hallo? Is that the Public Library? ... You have a Miss Helen Stephens employed there?  Yes... can you tell me if her name is spelt with a V or a PH, I want to send her a tic-PH? ... Thank you.
And now that you know... I want you with me... a while.
Replies.Didascalie: (he locks the door with a hint of sadness)

Replies.Reply: You'll be safe - as long as I can't see you frightened - so stand in the shadows, Helen... please...
All the rooms were wired for sound... and... still are.
Do you know... what the most frightening thing in the world is?...
So I did something... very simple...
When they felt the spike... touching their throats... and knew I was going to kill them...
... I made them - watch their own deaths!
Made them see their own terror as the spike went in... and if death has a face, they saw that too!
Not you! Not you! I'll never photograph you! I promised - I promised - Not you!  Helen's eyes are closed. The spike is still touching her throat.
I've been ready for this... for such a long time...
Watch them, Helen... Watch them say goodbye - one by one -

Replies.Didascalie: (he presses a master switch on the wait)

Replies.Reply: I wish... I could have found your faces for you...
I... er... have been told by a friend that you... er... have some views for sale?
I'll take this one... and, er...
Well, er... thank you very much.
Oh no! But I'll look in again...
Well look who's here! Cecil Beaton!
Come on, sonny... make us famous.
Did you read about that girl who was murdered last night?
The same thing nearly happened to me!
Last night! I went out with my boyfriend... We're getting married next month... trouble was my fiance saw us.
can you fix it so the bruises don't show?
Then be quick about it, sonny! I'm freezing.
There he goes again! What have you got under there? A girlfriend?
I suppose you have a girlfriend?
Oh, did you? Well if you want it again, I'll think of you!
You're a puzzle and a half.
This is a spare time job for you, isn't it?
Well, what do you do for a living?
Well what sort do you like?
That'll be a treat, I'm sure.
Oh no, sonny! Now take one I can show my mother.
Some house! Hope it falls on his ruddy earhole!
Come on, love. Don't be shy.
You've spoiled my whole evening, you have!
Why? Going on manoeuvres with the boy scouts?
You're a document and a half, you are. Is it safe to be alone with you?
... might be more fun if it wasn't...
He said... you needn't photograph my face!
I suppose you'll fix my bruises too?
Twenty-one today, She's twenty-one today, She's got the key of the door, She's never been twenty-one before.
Happy birthday... dear Helen  He obviously means it.
The party looks like breaking up, and we were wondering if...
Certainly... and then I must go to my room.
You haven't much time for me these days.
It's all right - I'll be here - if you want me.
... by the way... your mother was yelling out something before you came in... about Mark photographing her.
No one will come in... honestly, darling...
I don't know how many times we've passed each other on the stairs?
... but tonight I'm determined at least to say hello to you! So hello!
I'm having a party - and the other tenants are there...  And a few friends. We'd like you to join us.
Please come in... you'll meet the others who live here, and...
Well, I hope to keep it going for hours yet... so when you've finished why not look in?
I hope I'm not disturbing you?
I knew you wouldn't come down...
I mustn't keep you from your work  She turns to go.
a hostess can't drink water at her own party, it looks like a hint to the guests.
Very much... if you can spare it?
This is a pleasant room... and you've another inside?
How long have you lived here?
Do you mean I've at last found out who our landlord is? Your father?
But you walk about as if you haven't paid the rent.
The rent's very reasonable, but don't say anything to the others or you'll have no peace.
On the photographic side, I'll bet.
No thank you... to do with photography?
When I came in were you looking at some films?
Know I'm being rude... but I really would like to see them...
But I suppose you're too busy?
This is so... well - so many things... but above all - it's so...
...completely unexpected!  She looks at him searchingly.
I mean... is it designed by you? Furnished by you? Tell me about this room.
But it seems to be so... technical.
If this is where you work, I can't wait to see what you work at.
Well... what were you looking at when I interrupted you?
It's the first I've ever asked for...
Of course it is!  Then who took this film?
You'll be able to show it to your own chi...
You must have had a bad dream...
...but what was that light?  ...The camera, I suppose?  Mark does not answer. The small screen is filled with the face of the screaming, terrified child.

Whatever are you after?  WE SEE the little boy lying flat on the wall staring at something... rapt, motionless.  The cine-camera which is taking this picture now tracks rather clumsily towards the wall.
Naughty boy I hope you were spanked!
... but, Mark... what a strange thing for your father to photograph.
No.  The small screen begins to dissolve ...so does the large one.
I hate people who chatter in films - but there's so much I want to ask.
Mark, this isn't some kind of jo...
help me to understand this... this nightmare...
All right... now look... Mark - what was all that about?
... that was a lizard, wasn't it? Or a...
Well how did it get there?... How did it get there Mark?...  Was it a pet?
I like to understand what I'm shown!
What was your father trying to do?... Photographing you at nigh...
What was he trying to do to you?
What was he trying to do to you?
And those lights in your eyes?...
A scientist drops a lizard onto a child's bed - and good comes of it?
If only about lizards!  Mark - it sounds to me as if your father was...
Why do you still live in his house... and watch his films?
A photographer? It's no wonder, is it? But you still haven't shown me anything you've photographed!
What else can I read you?
Yes.  MRS. STEPHENS Well he is... I heard him come in... four paragraphs ago.
... and I think he could help me.
You don't like him! Now why not?
remember that you lost the toss.
Mother heard you come in - so I guessed you wouldn't be in bed ...
Are you sure this is conven...
I hope you don't mind - is it a tape-recorder?
I'm sure I'm being a nuisance...
Mark! That's very sweet of you - but really.
Mark, I'm here for some advice.
... I work in a public library - in the children's section... I'm telling you that to postpone admitting what always embarrasses me...
In my spare time... I write.
I learned today... that my first book... has been accepted! ... For publication in the spring...
A magic camera - and what it photographs...
I'll tell you one day - I promise...

I'll tell you that too - but, Mark... this is the problem... The children who read the book will want to see the pictures the camera takes - but the publishers say they're impossible to photograph, and suggest drawings... but I don't agree.
was hoping you'd say that! There must be photographs - however difficult to take - and I was wondering, Mark - if you'd...
Mark - I can't ask you to do that...
I mean... the publisher's mightn't agree.
I didn't mean to offend you.
Mark - I must go... I just wanted to know... if you'd talk it over with me.
Thank you for listening... and for my present.
she was appearing in Arthur Baden's new film The Walls Are Closing In, starring Diane Ashley.
a spokesman at the studio said that her performance in the film showed such promise, that her role was to have been built up... All work at the studio ceased today as a tribute to her memory!
I've no idea - and I don't suppose he has...
I'll bring him in and introduce you if...
How did you know where he was standing?
I'd like you to come in for a moment - and meet my mother.
Darling, this is Mark... Mark, my mother.
Thank you, Mark - You deserve a drink for that! What would you like?
Darling, I've left your supper in the...
Darling, may I tell you about your supper?
Darling, we forgot to toss.  Mrs. Stephens grunts.
Supper's laid out in the kitchen.
We'll be early! Good night, darling.
I want to ask you something rather personal...
How long is it since you've gone out without that?
Exactly. I've never seen you without it... but are you going to need it tonight?
Well are you? And if so... shall I bring some work with me too?
Good - then give it to me!
...It'll be quite safe - I'll put it away for you.
Then take it upstairs - if you can't trust me with it...
Come in - and see for yourself.
We'll put it in here - and lock it.
I am being tactless, aren't I? ... It's just that... I thought it was growing into an extra limb, and - but you bring it with you if you want to.
Thank you...  She takes it from him, puts it into the cupboard, and locks it. Then offers him the key.
I like this place! And this dinner!
I'm ready to talk about you...
It won't take a second - and it's best to have it said.
Carrying a camera is only one of your habits, isn't it, Mark?

... when you stared at that couple, you were like the little boy on that film you showed me... looking over the wall at something he shouldn't see. But Mark - you're strong enough now to lift that child off the wall... aren't you?
Will you, Mark?... Will you really?
Yes, Mark... in case, one day, a child comes in and asks for it!
I'm not popular with my customers! They ask me for horror comics - and I take their sticky hands and drag them to where there are books!
... and do you know, Mark, waiting for them to come in next time and ask for books... is as exciting...
It's owned by a little boy who is terrified of grown-ups... but when he looks in his magic camera he sees grown-ups as they were when they were children... and he isn't frightened any longer.
... and one day he gives his camera away to a little boy who is even more frightened of grown-ups than he was - and do you know what he finds?
... that when he looks at grown-
... I looked out of my window - and saw you going off to work carrying that camera like a little boy with a satchel... and an idea came... so thank you...
Now what do I do about the photographs?
Mother must have gone to bed.
Mark, it was a wonderful evening...

Replies.Reply: And you made it wonderful... without your camera.
...me, for instance... now that I am one.
... thank you, again, for my evening.
Will you go to bed now - and not stop up watching those films?

Replies.Reply: Photographing Mother? You must be mistaken!
Mark?  No answer. She looks thoughtfully at the envelope in her hand - then goes in to the dark-room.

Replies.Reply: She's right... your mother... must tell someone everything... sorry...
This was his laboratory... and you know some of what he did... but not all.
What did you do... to those girls?
If you want to torment me... for the rest of my life... then make me imagine!
What did you do ... to those girls?
Show me - or I'll remain frightened... for the rest of my life.  Show me!
Would you enquire if our leading lady is ready to start leading.
Darling, you've only been playing this part for three weeks, so in case you haven't yet had a chance to read the script...
... may I remind you that you're a girl with an irresistible impulse!
a kleptomaniac! Who cannot help stealing... Get inside her, Diane!... What - in all the world - do you most want to steal?
We'll run the scene where you catch sight of the store detective and faint... Where's the girl who plays the bystander?
Hit that floor with a thud!
... just this once... will you please make an effort to forget that you're stunning, and try to look as if you're stunned...?
Print it!  He glances at his watch - then nods to the Assistant Director.
No - no - no - we must get some comedy into this...!
I want some comedy in this scene...
Instead of taking the first trunk you see, I want you, darling... to ask for a blue trunk - and when he brings it to you, to ask for a red one - and when he brings that, to ask for a white one...
And you, Michael... get the trunks one by one - growing more and more fed up - and we'll end on a gag which I'll think of in a minute - all right?
Never mind - I'm cutting her out of this scene... Let's run it.
The silly bitch! She's fainted in the wrong scene...
Inspector, have you convinced yourself he's a member of my unit?
Waiting for me on the set.
But, Inspector, the strain on them is already...
On the dolly... the camera... You can watch everyone and everything from there... including me!
Try it, darling... We'll all be with you.
All right, everyone! Back at two!
Till the police arrive... D.J.'s orders.
D.J. says not to discuss it.
All right, everyone - let's run it...
I mean to help her psychologically...
We're stopping at four today - so have a quick lunch, everyone! Back at two sharp!
All right, everyone. This is the last shot... Make it a good one!
Is it tonight?  CLOSE SHOT of Mark.
You're sure we won't be caught?
Mark... I want to be quite clear about this...
You'll then print the film - so I can show it to my agent and anyone else who matters - right?
I've been offered film tests before... but I haven't liked the terms.
Then why are you doing this? Risking your job and...
No... you want to direct... more badly than anything don't you?
Very much, especially if there's a part for me.
No one could... they'd be caught!
Besides, how would you frighten anyone to death?
You'd better not tell me! I'll be scared to death tonight as it is!
Back on the set - shall I go first?
No, thanks... I've a date... at the Local.
Where are you?  His voice is quietly overlaid.
Now listen... they're working late on the lot.
We must call it off... someone's bound to see us.
They'll wait outside... what's the difference?
Sign on the dotted line, kiddies! You can use my pen, but bring your own ink!
Mark... if you're sure it's worth it?
Mark puts the cine-camera and the black cloth bag on the dolly, slowly mounts the platform, closes the blimp - and swings the camera.
I do feel alone in front of it...
Then I'm great, boy! What is it you want me to act?
He looks up from the camera; she smiles and starts keeping time to the rhythm again.

Replies.Reply: Yes - and I'll have a go!
I've been wondering all the afternoon how you'd do it!  I'll bet you've thought of a wonderful twist!
Why not pull the studio down while you're about it? They can only hang you once.
If only Don Jarvis could see me now!
If only I could see Don Jarvis now!
I warn you, Mark - I'm hysterical...
Oh well! I've stood alone in front of a studio camera! That's more than most have.
I can see you, Mark... perfectly!
Yes, sir! I'll bet I'm the best camerawoman in the business! . . .
Mark hurries to the side of the studio camera and picks up his cine-camera.
Am I supposed to imagine someone is going to put me in there?
Mark - I hope I won't let you down... I know you're trying to create atmosphere for me - but...
Oh all right! I could do anything - I feel so relaxed - and that's due to you... You're so at home with that camera you make me feel at home too... you have it in you, boy!
But how would he frighten me to?  She stares into focusing screen - intrigued, but not frightened, not even by the silence and shadowy vastness around her.
I can't imagine what you've thought of!

Thought I saw you talking to somebody...
Be seeing you  He wanders off.

colleague's car... there's room for two on my lap - three at a pinch.
...she said she didn't want a lift - because she had a call to make locally.

and when she opened that trunk...

In light of the new economy drive...

is this a gag?... A girl in a trunk!... Who is she?... Well, which unit?... The walls are closing in?... What a break for them!... I mean what a heartbreak!

I'm familiar with that kind of terror. This is something new to me... but what?
...now take a look at how we found her.

Make me famous. Some chap was giving me a screen test  The Extra's voice is overlaid - a hint of hysteria in it.

I'm Chief Inspector Gregg and this is Sergeant Miller. Grab a chair.

direct me to that set of yours, will you? I'd probably end on location.

...thanks for the escort  The Inspector hurries towards the door of the set.  The Constable opens it - and the Inspector goes inside.  The Constable closes the door - and stands in front of it.  Mark turns away quickly.

I don't want to spoil anyone's fun, but we do have a maniac on our hands, and if we don't get him quickly there'll be a third unsolved murder to report to the Commissioner. So let's hurry things up, shall we?
It could be any of them...
I'll be frank. I'd welcome anyone's help... I don't know how this maniac kills - or why he kills - or who he'll kill next, but if he isn't caught quickly...

No, sir ... but a few things seem to point to it... No one outside your unit admits to knowing the girl... There was a trunk all ready for her... and with the risks he was running, I think he'd have to use surroundings he was familiar with... Where is your unit now?
I'd like to watch them at their jobs, sir. It may tell me more than a hundred interviews.
I'm afraid it is, sir... now where could I get the best view?
Very well, sir ... I'll become a member of your camera crew...

I suspect 'em all - what about you?
I want to see how some of them spend their spare time...

philia... The morbid urge to gaze...

CLOSE SHOT of Helen. She is standing by the projector, holding her envelope thoughtfully.
